alert.note: Alert for Houghton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued October 17 at 4:37AM EDT until October 17 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy, wet snow is expected to result in hazardous winter driving conditions for the morning commute. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches expected along the spine of the Keweenaw Peninsula and 2 to 4 inches in the higher terrain south of Houghton. Northwest to north winds gusting as high as 50 mph at times. * WHERE...Northern Houghton Counties. * WHEN...Until 8 PM EDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult in some areas. The hazardous conditions will impact the commutes this morning and this evening. Gusty winds and wet snow could bring down tree branches, resulting in sporadic power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Since this is the first winter storm of the season, extra caution is urged for those who must travel.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
